roleset.name: win, accomplish some task, successful, accomplished
roleset.note: SUCCEED-V NOTES: Adjectival 'successful' based on BOLT-4,5. Corresponds to VN class succeed-74-1. (from succeed.01-v)
SUCCESS-N NOTES: Roleset based on suceed.01. No corresponding VN class. Framed by Katie. (from success.01-n)
SUCCESSFUL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from successful.01-j)

example.name: entity mentioned, task not
example.text: Ford might succeed because many shareholders are speculators keen for a full bid.
example.arg: because many shareholders are speculators keen for a full bid

example.name: entity and task mentioned
example.text: If the government succeeds in seizing Mr. Antar's assets, he could be left without top-flight legal representation, because his attorneys are likely to quit, according to individuals familiar with the case.

example.name: adjectival rel: successful
example.text: Personally , I do n't think long - distant relationships would be successful .

example.name: Example with both args
example.text: the success of Senate Democrats in stalling the capital gains tax cut
example.arg: in stalling the capital gains tax cut

example.name: Example with only arg 0
example.text: the expected success of the Lisa computer , introduced in 1983
example.arg: of the Lisa computer , introduced in 1983

example.name: Example with only arg 1
example.text: The success of their tests using anthrax simulant and artificial artillery rockets
example.arg: of their tests using anthrax simulants and artificial artillery rockets

example.name: Another example with both args
example.text: His success in a new television show

roleset.name: take over for
roleset.note: SUCCEED-V NOTES: Frames file for 'succeed' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Comparison with 'win' and 'replace' and 'take_over'. (from succeed.02-v)
SUCCESSION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on succeed-v.02. No corresponding VNcls. (from succession.01-n)

example.name: no role or function
example.text: Stephen Akerfeldt, currently vice president finance, will succeed Mr. McAlpine.
example.arg: Stephen Akerfeldt, currently vice president finance

example.name: with role/function
example.text: Edward L. Kane succeeded Mr. Taylor as chairman.

example.name: argMs
example.text: a planned succession at the company

example.name: all args
example.text: the office was vacant following his succession of Abraham Lincoln as President

roleset.name: be subsequent to
roleset.note: SUCCESSION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on succeed-v.03, internet examples. No corresponding VNcls. Note: partative usages such as "a succession of problems" are not eventive and should be treated as .ER. (from succession.02-n)

example.name: adjectival
example.text: All this was recognized and documented in the succeeding years by economists, some of whom worked in the Reagan administration to lift this burden from the American people, states and local governments.

example.name: both args- chronological publication of books
example.text: In the context of 'The Orphan', for instance, 'Streamers' announces itself clearly a further step in Rabe's inquiry ... And in the context of its succession after 'Boom Boom Room', we may put the matter of 'Streamers' and its putative status as 'Vietnam drama' ...
